member.name: T:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Interpretation.Interpreter.InstructionInterpreter
member.summary: Interpreter of instructions.
member.remarks: This interpreter defines the meaning of all instructions in terms of a terms and an abstract state. It provides facilities to build a dynamic call graph, path condition, and bound the execution.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Monitoring.IThreadExecutionMonitor.CallvirtType(Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.TypeEx,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is called after to indicate the actual type of the receiver object.
member.remarks: This method is only called when the receiver was not null, and an exception is thrown otherwise. When the receiver is a boxed value, is the value type. When a constrained call is performed, the type is the type pointed to by the receiver pointer. When the receiver is a remote object, might not be a class but an interface.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Monitoring.IThreadExecutionMonitor.CallReceiver(System.Object)
member.summary: This method is called after , and then after , and to indicate the actual receiver object.
member.remarks: When the receiver object is null for a , this method is not called.

member.summary: This method is called after and and to indicate the receiver object.

member.param: An index used in the access.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Monitoring.ThreadExecutionMonitorBase.RaiseException(System.Object,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is called when an exception occurs, either because it was thrown by a called method, or because it was trigged by some other instruction.
member.remarks: When an exception occurs, one of the following specific methods is called: , , , , , , , . By default, they call this method. Because all auxiliary exception handlers introduced by the instrumentation rethrow the exception afterwards, the same exception might be reported more than once.

whether all instance fields of the new object should be updated to default values; if not, the instance fields' values are undefined

member.summary: Constructs a List, copying the contents of the given collection. The size and capacity of the new list will both be equal to the size of the given collection.

member.summary: Sorts the elements in this list. Uses the default comparer and SafeArray.Sort.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Collections.SafeList`1.Sort(System.Comparison{`0})
member.summary: Sorts the elements in this list. Uses SafeArray.Sort with the provided comparison

member.name: M:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Collections.SafeList`1.Sort(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Comparison{`0})
member.summary: Sorts the elements in a section of this list. The sort compares the elements to each other using the given IComparer interface. If comparer is null, the elements are compared to each other using the IComparable interface, which in that case must be implemented by all elements of the list. This method uses the SafeArray.Sort method to sort the elements.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Collections.SafeList`1.Sort(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IComparer{`0})
member.summary:
Sorts the elements in a section of this list. The sort compares the elements to each other using the given IComparer interface. If comparer is null, the elements are compared to each other using the IComparable interface, which in that case must be implemented by all elements of the list.
This method uses the SafeArray.Sort method to sort the elements.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Collections.SafeList`1.SortRanked
member.summary: Sorts the elements of the list using the RankedComparer comparer that sorts element according to the IRanked interface.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Collections.SafeList`1.ToIndexable
member.summary: returns a new Object array containing the contents of the List. Wrapped as a safe enumeration.

member.summary: Try to retrieve an instruction at a particular offset.
member.remarks: The offset must be a legal instruction start offset in the sequence of instructions. If no instruction is available at offset 0, this indicates that no instructions available at all.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.MethodBodyEx.TryGetInstructionSkipNop(System.Int32,Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.Instruction@)
member.summary: Try to retrieve an instruction at a particular offset, and skips any occurence of the nop instruction.
member.remarks: The offset must be a legal instruction start offset in the sequence of instructions. If no instruction is available at offset 0, this indicates that no instructions available at all.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.XmlDocumentation.TypeLoader.LoadType(System.String,Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.AssemblyEx)

member.name: M:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.XmlDocumentation.TypeLoader.TryGetType(System.String,Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.AssemblyEx,Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.TypeEx@)
member.summary: Loads a type used by usingAssembly. Caches result.
member.param: null value will result in LogError.
null value will result in LogError.
member.returns: null iff we could not load the type.
member.remarks: When everything was compiled with the C# compiler standard options, then this should return the right Type. The C# compiler allows the using assembly to shadow type definitions of referenced assemblies. We take this into account by first searching the using assembly, then we proceed to referenced assemblies. TODO(t-ccsall): What happens in general? I.e., with C# compiler option /reference http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/64wh5743.aspx

member.name: M:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Symbols.SourcePathResolver.Resolve(System.String)
member.summary: Maps pdb full path to user provided source path
member.remarks:
The pdb usually stores full path, i.e. file://d:\mysources\product\foo.cs
If the pdb is used on another machine, the user will provide a root source path: \\mymachine\mysources
We are looking to update those paths:
\\mymachine\mysources\product\foo.cs

member.summary: Describes the kind of a .
member.remarks: has a field that allows fast switches over the kind of the layout.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.LayoutKind.I1
member.summary: Memory layout of an integer value that is 1 byte long.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.LayoutKind.I2
member.summary: Memory layout of an integer value that is 2 bytes long.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.LayoutKind.I4
member.summary: Memory layout of an integer value that is 4 bytes long.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.LayoutKind.I8
member.summary: Memory layout of an integer value that is 8 bytes long.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.LayoutKind.R4
member.summary: Memory layout of a floating-point value that is 4 bytes long.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.LayoutKind.R8
member.summary: Memory layout of a floating-point value that is 8 bytes long.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.LayoutKind.Ref
member.summary: Memory layout of a reference value that points to an object.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.LayoutKind.StructField
member.summary: Internally used memory layout to represent a struct field.
member.remarks: An intuitive interpretation of an (abstract) value with this layout is the offset of a struct field within a struct value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.LayoutKind.Method
member.summary: Internally used memory layout to represent a method.
member.remarks: An intuitive interpretation of an (abstract) value with this layout is the address in memory of a method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.LayoutKind.Type
member.summary: Internally used memory layout to represent a type.
member.remarks: An intuitive interpretation of an (abstract) value with this layout is the address in memory of a type descriptor.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.LayoutKind.Uniform
member.summary: Layout of a map from keys to values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.LayoutKind.Struct
member.summary: Layout of a tuple from struct-fields to their values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.LayoutKind.MdIndex
member.summary: Layout of a tuple of indices into a multi-dimensional array

member.name: F:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.LayoutKind.ManagedPointer
member.summary: Layout of a manager pointer to another layout

member.name: T:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.Layout
member.summary: Layout describes the memory layout of a value
member.remarks: The concept of layout is modelled after the relevant "type" system of the VES (Virtual Execution System).

member.name: M:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.Layout.GetHashCode
member.summary: Retrieves a unique hash code for this layout.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.Layout.NoLayouts
member.summary: Empty array.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.Layout.I4
member.summary: Memory layout of an integer value that is 4 byte long.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.Layout.I8
member.summary: Memory layout of an integer value that is 8 byte long.

member.name: F:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.Layout.I
member.summary: Memory layout of an integer value that has the native integer size.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.Interfaces.IAssemblyDefinition.TryGetImageRuntimeVersion(System.String@)
member.summary: Tries to get a string representing the version of the common language runtime (CLR) saved in the file containing the manifest.
member.value: A string representing the CLR version folder name. This is not a full path.
member.remarks: For example, the value for the .NET Framework version 1.1 would be v1.1.4322. The binary files for that version would be located in the path %windir%\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v1.1.4322. By default, ImageRuntimeVersion is set to the version of the CLR used to build the assembly. However, it might have been set to another value at compile time.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Emit.FSharp.FSharpHelper.IsInvalidGenericConstraint(Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.Interfaces.IType)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the type can be used in the F# type constraint
member.remarks: A class-type constraint must satisfy the following rules: The type must be a class type (not implemented) The type must not be sealed (not implemented) The type must not be one of the following types: System.Array, System.Delegate, System.Enum, or System.ValueType (implemented) The type must not be object. Because all types derive from object, such a constraint would have no effect if it were permitted (implemented) At most one constraint for a given type parameter can be a class type (not implemented

member.name: T:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.CommandLine.CommandLineParser
member.summary:
Parser for command line arguments.
The parser specification is infered from the instance fields of the object specified as the destination of the parse. Valid argument types are: int, uint, string, bool, enums Also argument types of Array of the above types are also valid.
Error checking options can be controlled by adding a ArgumentAttribute to the instance fields of the destination object.
At most one field may be marked with the DefaultArgumentAttribute indicating that arguments without a '-' or '/' prefix will be parsed as that argument.
If not specified then the parser will infer default options for parsing each instance field. The default long name of the argument is the field name. The default short name is the first character of the long name. Long names and explicitly specified short names must be unique. Default short names will be used provided that the default short name does not conflict with a long name or an explicitly specified short name.
Arguments which are array types are collection arguments. Collection arguments can be specified multiple times.

member.returns: true if no errors were detected.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Emit.CSharp.CSharpHelper.IsInvalidGenericConstraint(Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.Interfaces.IType)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating if the type can be used in the C# type constraint
member.remarks: A class-type constraint must satisfy the following rules: The type must be a class type (not implemented) The type must not be sealed (not implemented) The type must not be one of the following types: System.Array, System.Delegate, System.Enum, or System.ValueType (implemented) The type must not be object. Because all types derive from object, such a constraint would have no effect if it were permitted (implemented) At most one constraint for a given type parameter can be a class type (not implemented

member.name: M:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Metadata.Builders.AssemblyDefinitionBuilder.Microsoft#ExtendedReflection#Metadata#Interfaces#IAssemblyDefinition#TryGetImageRuntimeVersion(System.String@)
member.summary: Gets a string representing the version of the common language runtime (CLR) saved in the file containing the manifest.
member.value: A string representing the CLR version folder name. This is not a full path.
member.remarks: For example, the value for the .NET Framework version 1.1 would be v1.1.4322. The binary files for that version would be located in the path %windir%\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v1.1.4322. By default, ImageRuntimeVersion is set to the version of the CLR used to build the assembly. However, it might have been set to another value at compile time.

member.summary: Gets the monitoring instrumentation flags
Gets the monitoring environment variables.
member.param: Whether GC addresses should be monitored.
The substitution assemblies. Must be fully qualified file names.
The list of types for which the static cctor should be skiped
The list of type for which finalizer should be skipped
Name of the CLR monitor log file.
if set to if the profiler should just terminate the process on failure instead of opening friendly diagnosis windows; only configurable in DEBUG builds
Whether all static constructors should be protected (i.e. whether no callbacks should be issued from static constructors)
if set to true [disable mscorlib supressions].

member.name: M:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Monitoring.ControllerSetUp.UnsetMonitoringEnvironmentVariables
member.summary: Clears all ExtendedReflection environment variables
Gets a monitorable process start info
Creates a that will enable monitoring for the process start with this info.
member.param: name of executable for new process
arguments given to entry point of new process: must be quoted appropriately
Whether GC addresses should be monitored
The substitution assemblies. Must be fully qualified file names.
list of type names to monitor in new process; monitors all methods in type
list of assemblies to monitor in new process; monitors all types in assembly
The list of types for which the static cctor should be skiped. Requires protectAllCctors
The list of type for which finalizer should be skipped
optional; file name of log file for debug information of the instrumentation framework; may only be functional in debug builds
if set to if the profiler should just terminate the process on failure instead of opening friendly diagnosis windows; only configurable in DEBUG builds
optional; name of the desired, clr version, e.g. v2.0.x86chk
Whether all static constructors should be protected (i.e. whether no callbacks should be issued from static constructors)
if set to true [disable mscorlib supressions].

member.name: T:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Utilities.VirtualMemory
member.summary: Helper to allocate Win32 memory at fixed addresses.
member.remarks:
The allocated memory region is separated into 3 areas. Two offset define a lower and upper regions where read and write should not occur. The 'active' memory region is exposed to the user through the BaseAddress and Size properties.
The instance can validate the memory after a run by ensuring that the values in the left and right regions are still 0. This mechanism will detect incorrect writes, but won't detect incorrect reads.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Utilities.Format.Aside(Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Utilities.Format,System.Int32,System.Int32,Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Utilities.Format)
member.summary: Two Formats can be put aside. A space and an Indent is given. The numbers of spaces are inserted if the Formats are put on the same line; the Indent is used if the Formats need to be put on different lines. The algorithm for printing affixed Formats is as follows: the Right format is converted under the assumption a break has took place, i.e. it assumes the current margin width minus the Indent. But if its resulting width in fact fits on the current line with the Left format's representation, space's are inserted and the format is put on the current line. The result of this algorithm in general is that deeper nested affixes glue tighter.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Collections.SafeEquatableDictionary`2
member.summary: A safe replacement for dictionary.
member.remarks: Safe here means that this class will not be instrumented. This implementation is deterministic, i.e. the hashcode of values does not affect the order in which elements are returned by the enumerator.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Collections.SafeEquatableDictionary`2.GetOrCreateValue``1(`0,``0,Microsoft.ExtendedReflection.Collections.SafeEquatableDictionary{`0,`1}.ValueCreator{``0})

member.name: T:__NonPublicReceiverAttribute
member.summary: Methods marked by an attribute of this type use 'object' as the receiver type (or 'UIntPtr' for struct methods) to avoid visibility issues.
member.remarks: Usually, only calls to public implementation methods will be substituted. This implies that all parameters must be public. This attribute can be used as a workaround if only the receiver type is not public. Note that the unmanaged profiler does not care where this attribute is defined; it simply looks for an attribute which has the name __NonPublicReceiverAttribute.

member.name: T:__ProtectAttribute
member.summary: Types marked by an attribute of this type will be protected, i.e. a protection context will be set around the method body.
member.remarks: Note that the unmanaged profiler does not care where this attribute is defined; it simply looks for an attribute which has the name __ProtectAttribute.

member.name: T:__DoNotInstrumentAttribute
member.summary: Types marked by an attribute of this type will not be instrumented.
member.remarks: Note that the unmanaged profiler does not care where this attribute is defined; it simply looks for an attribute which has the name __DoNotInstrumentAttribute.

member.name: T:__InstrumentAttribute
member.summary: Types marked by an attribute of this type or assembly will be instrumented.
member.remarks: Note that the unmanaged profiler does not care where this attribute is defined; it simply looks for an attribute which has the name __InstrumentAttribute.

member.name: T:__NonPublicAttribute
member.summary: Methods marked by an attribute of this type will be used for substitutions even if the implementation method is not public.
member.remarks: Usually, only calls to public implementation methods will be substituted. Note that the unmanaged profiler does not care where this attribute is defined; it simply looks for an attribute which has the name __NonPublicAttribute.
